predicate.note: Frames file for 'notice' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entry 30.1.

roleset.name: become aware of

example.name: more bad poetry
example.text: Air-traffic problems, though often quite grim / This time of year leave us in stitches / When we notice around our airport / A holding pattern for witches.

example.name: sentential thing noticed
example.text: Richard Breeden hadn't noticed that his new desk had just four telephone lines and one phone.
example.arg: his new desk had just four telephone lines and one phone

example.name: nominal thing noticed
example.text: The guest paid his bill at the resort hotel, and as he departed he noticed a sign saying, ``Have You Left Anything?''
example.arg: a sign saying, ``Have You Left Anything?''

example.name: passivized
example.text: That can be expensive, because the problem may not be noticed *trace* for a while, and the sheets are typically thrown away.

example.name: rare English pro-drop
example.text: *trace* Didn't feel a thing, but noticed some strange bird behavior.

example.name: wh-clause as arg1
example.text: Harry has avoided all that by living in a Long Island suburb with his wife, who's so addicted to soap operas and mystery novels she barely seems *trace* to notice when her husband disappears for drug-seeking forays into Manhattan.
example.arg: when her husband disappears for drug-seeking forays into Manhattan

roleset.note: AS with many other verbs, wh-complementizers are included in the arg but other complementizers are not.
